comments.body: Are these going to be thrown away code when we bump the version again in the future releases?
I think we should keep. Even if we bump to version 4, we should test is we can upgrade to version 5.
Why this change? What's `usedSubscriptionMetadataVersionPeek` used for? I don't see it in any assertions or something along those lines.

Oh, it's used in `StreamsUpgradeTestIntegrationTest`, but not via field access. You can pass in an AtomicInteger, and then use it in assertions to "peek" at the current value for `usedSubscriptionMetadataVersion` internal to the assignor.

I'm using it to make direct assertions about the version at different points in the protocol without having to grep the logs.

Just because I deleted a constructor whose only purpose was to fill in this value. It seems trivial to add it at the call site, and then you don't have to have 15 constructors for the class (hyperbole, of course).
Ah yeah that makes sense, nice cleanup as well.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +260,264 @@                            subscription.topics(),
                            new SubscriptionInfo(
                                LATEST_SUPPORTED_VERSION,
                                LATEST_SUPPORTED_VERSION,
                                info.processId(),
